lines.text: This is Inspector Winship and Dr. Tart. They were in the yard.
That's FROM the Yard.
You want another glass of pus?
No I don't want another glass of pus!
You know, I have an idea. Whoever wrote that letter must have read about us in the newspaper.
What is it?
What's what?
The idea you have?
I just told you!
What was it?
Whoever wrote that letter must have read about us in the newspaper.
Right! Now that letter was signed 'Lord Morley'. So he must have read about us in the newspaper and called us in to solve his murder.
How could Lord Morley write us after he was already dead?
Right! You know what? Maybe whoever killed Lord Morley wrote that letter.
If you killed Lord Morley would you write to someone and ask them to find the killer?
Are you saying *I* killed Lord Morley?
(aggravated) No! I'm saying you kill me!

[reading the note from the killer]
I said when I died, that I'd come back. If you believe in ghosts, you're on the right track. I'm out of the grave, and roaming the moores. If you want to be safe, you better lock all the windows and screens.
[Reading a note next to the dead Hilda]
Hilda is dead, and here's something to note. You can't bury her at sea, 'cause her bosoms will float.
How about a nice bowl of fish eyes?
Will you pardon me, please?
Ah... Do you like hummingbird cookies?
...No, thank you.
For a short person, you have long sentences.

[reading the note from Jock's killer]
If Jock could talk, he'd give you a clue. But now that he's dead, what can you do? He deserved what he got, I don't regret it a bit. By the way, you're standing in bull ca-ca.
Listen up dummies. The help is all gone, the house is bare. Now you know, a shadow is there. There's one left to die, then my job'll be done. I like killing people, it's a lotta kicks!

[reading the note from Uwatsum's killer]
In this house, it's hard to survive. Some'll be dead, who are now alive. Mr. Uwatsum is gone, 'cause he knew too much. Bye for now, but rest assured we'll keep in constant contact with each other.

[reading the tombstone engraved by Tibet's killer]
To dig your own grave, is quite a sight. But to bury yourself, is not very bright. There are more to kill, and the job'll be done. Now there are five, soon there'll be a lot less.

[reading the note from Lord Morley]
Now you will see, I can do something right. I'm going to show you, a killer tonight. I want Phyllis to come to my chamber, and see. Who what the one, who murdered Lady Morley and myself.
Ah... So.
What'd you call me?
[Inspector Winship is interrogating Mr. Uwatsum, who is completely bald]

[to Inspector Winship]
Ask him where he gets his hair done.
[the staff are introducing themselves to Winship and Tart]

[in a slurred and garbled speech]
My name is Jock. I'm the groom. I was under Lord Morley's command in India. He had my tongue cut out...
Just a second. What did you say?
He said,
[imitating Jock's speech, only more garbled]
He said that his name is Jock. He was under Lord Morley's command...
Will you shut up?

[still imitating Jock's speech]
That's what he said!
[the Shadow rolls a bomb toward the detectives, who are facing the other way]
We must be near a bowling alley.

[During the interrogation of the staff]
I am Justin... the butler. I was accused of killing my wife and her lovers. But Lord Morley
[begins crying]
, bless him!... convinced the authorities it was a case of justifiable insanity... and
[sobs heavier]
... and I've served him happily... ever since...
[crying heavily]

[Sympathetically]
How many lovers did your wife have?

[Instantly stops crying and says, coldly]
Thirteen.
This isn't one of your better inventions. Who ever heard of a gun that went off every hour?
Might save your life someday.
Yeah, if you have to shoot someone every hour.

[to Dr. Tart]
Oh say, do you know you got stuff all over your face?
Huh?
You got stuff all over your face.
He's oiling his brain.
You better get a pigeon in case we have to contact The Yard.
Right. I'm gonna take Judy. Harold has been under the weather lately; stool has been a little loose.
That's too bad. I'll have to put a Get Well card on the bottom of his cage.

[regarding the Morley Manor]
Look at that house. That's bigger than that hometown I grew up in.

[What his mother said about Inspector Winship]
You know what she always used to say? She said if you had another brain you'd be lonesome.

[about Lord Morly]
He claimed to have the power to return from the dead.
They say the wookalars have the power to return from the dead, too, and they only have a brain the size of a pea.
In that case, you'd have a hard time getting into the group.
